data.title: Add a new label to production buildings
data.body: As is discussed in #5477, I think there should be a separate label called something like "Production Building" to show where the units will come out. Because let's say I build three barracks and haven't set a primary, then there is no way to see from which one units will come out unless I remember the chronology.

data.title: Makes newest production-building the primary building
data.body:
This is something that has troubled me a lot:

If you have a production-building and then build a new one of this type, the units will come out of the newest.
But if you made one of these a primary building in the past and then build a new building of this type, the units will still come out of the primary building - and not out of the newest.

It is better to always have the newest building be the primary building as soon as you place it.
I will explain why and i hope you guys agree - especially the players with a lot of experience.

Both ways have a problem.

The way it was until now has the problem: The behavior of having units always come of the newest building changes as soon as you made one of those a primary building earlier.
In this case, you have the trouble of having to make the newest building the primary building first, if you want units to come out of this one.

My way has the problem: The behavior of units always come out of the explicitly made primary building changes when you build a new building of this type.
In this case, you have the trouble of having to make your desired building the primary building again, if you for whatever reason do not want em to come of the new production building that you just built.

If you read the last line, you can already see that it is better the way i propose, as in 99% of the cases you want the units to come out of the newest building (but you can still make another building primary at any time) - this is the main reason you build a second building in the first place!
Plus, in the heat of battle - expecially in situations like chronoshifting your mcv and quickly place barracs/war fact behind the enemy's lines, or quickly dropping a barracks and spilling out E3s to defend against incoming mammoths you just saw - when every second counts, you dont want to have to select and right click a building first - or even think about it: "Gnah, now i forgot to make it primary, so the units came out in the other building at the other side of the map! :(".

So, both ways have problems, but i think the way i propose works better in practise!

data.title: Moved RallyPoint trait lookup into the constructor of Production
data.body: More performance, fewer crashes. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5472

data.title: Packaged CHANGELOG.html has bogus formatting
data.body: The list syntax is not transformed into `<ul>`.

data.title: Switch between (pseudo) fullscreen and window without restarting
data.body:
Seems possible now, preferably by using a key.

I would very much appreciate it (especially as my debugger has problems when I'm in fullscreen mode, but it would be a very nice feature anyway).

data.title: Crash when production structure is destroyed
data.body:
Reported [on the forum](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=16579).

```
Dune 2000 Mod at Version playtest-20140525
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (barro 271 (not in world))
at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[T](Actor actor)
at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Production.MoveToRallyPoint(Actor self, Actor newUnit, CPos exitLocation)
at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Production.<DoProduction>c__AnonStorey12B.<>m__217(World w)
at OpenRA.World.Tick()
at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
at OpenRA.Game.Run()
at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) 
```

data.title: Modular + UpgradeModule
data.body:
Added TS’s GDI Power Turbine.
Currently this doesn't support selling (or selecting, etc.) plugs independently.

Possibly fixes #3211 (in one of two ways).

I should note there is an example ingame with TS but it does not work due to cell layout, I assume.
If you test this in RA/TD/D2k you will see that it works as expected.

This responds oddly with plugs that are not 1x1 due to our numerous topleft assumptions (which is not too surprising).

data.title: Adds RallyPoint to Airfield
data.body:
I see no reason why the Airfield should not have a RP. Perhaps it was just forgotten to update the yaml.
Definitely makes sense to have it.

Only one of many examples where this is useful: U got only one airfield and want to build several yaks. With the RP, you dont have to send each yak somewhere else on its own, just that another one can be build - the airfield is not blocked anymore.

Regards.

data.title: Ported Fort Lonestar to Lua
data.body: A quick and simple conversion of the infamous stress-test benchmark _errr_ popular minigame https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/06b797fd14d25112afcf63ba153bffd439568816/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Missions/FortLonestarScript.cs I did this to test the new Lua bindings. You currently can't win this. Not because it is so damn hard, but because `MissionAccomplished` is not yet implemented. =) I removed all the bit-rot in the rules I could find, but there is still a lot to do. The code also needs a better structure.

data.title: Transmission Received - Alarm
data.body: play a sound like "bleep6.aud" (radar map alert) when a new transmission is received

data.body: Tested on different maps. This deploy cursor isn't appearing.

data.title: Update UPnP.cs
data.body: This is to discuss some changes that I think could worth.

data.title: replays should not record the time spent watching FMVs
data.body:
Follow-up to #4939 

Example 1:
- Play one of your single-player missions. Cancel the video that appears
- Watch the replay. Do NOT cancel the video playback

=> the replay starts while the video is still playing

Example 2:
- Play one of the single-player missions. Do NOT cancel the videos
- Watch the replay. DO cancel the video playback

=> you have to wait for as long as you watched the video while playing until the replay actually starts

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2349945-replays-should-not-record-the-time-spent-watching-fmvs?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Missing upgrade rules
data.body:
Tried to revive Fort Lonestar https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5469 and noticed some traits where not catched by map-upgrade:
- [x] CapturableBar → ExternalCapturableBar https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4021
- [x] CarpetBomb → AttackBomber (parameters also changed) https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4036

data.title: Change terrain type from string based dictionaries to arrays
data.body:
This replaces the string based dictionary lookups with arrays that are accessed by index. It partially follows the suggestions in #4596. The main difference being that it doesn't create bit fields, mainly because we want more info per terrain type than a boolean pass/can't pass (we store movement cost and speed).

It's difficult to test exactly how this performs but I see a 10+% speedup in movement/pathfinding related activities, on average.

I've tested several replays recorded on the current bleed with this and they don't desync, crash, or anything else strange so it seems this doesn't break anything obvious.

~~It requires #5447 or it will complain about invalid terrain templates and abort.~~ (edit: merged)

Please test & discuss. I plan to look for more cases that can be optimized and build on this PR so I'd like to know if the changes here are in the right direction.

data.title: Add remaining alternative gdi04 missions
data.body:
This adds gdi04b (scg04wa) and gdi04c (scg04wb).

gdi04b is similar to gdi04a objective-wise, gdi04c is completely different. Both have been tested with the latest balance changes. gdi04b is of medium difficulty, I'd say, and gdi0c is kinda hard. You probably need a few tries to figure out how to get past the start and survive with enough units to reach the end.

I did not want to get these merged while old lua still had the deprecation notice, but now that that is removed, I'd like to see them in. They are very much self-contained, so shouldn't cause any issues.

data.title: Replaced libraries with SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 SP3 binaries
data.body:
As reported by @boltronics at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3892#issuecomment-43444586 for http://uncyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Debian the linked libraries are "too new" in our bundled ones. I rebuilt them for SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 SP3 and that seems to work for @Zambezi (via IRC).
- https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/home:Mailaender:branches:games/SDL2
- https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/home:Mailaender:branches:devel:languages:lua/lua51

See also https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5460 for the alternative strategy to use the ones provided by the system for compatibility, more features and security.

data.title: Added support for SDL2 and Lua 5.1 system libraries
data.body: This time without relying on `lsb_release -is`.

data.title: Sort out the linux packaging mess
data.body:
Our packaging system needs to avoid:
- Dropping support for distros that we currently support, and are still supported by their vendor.
- Requiring unnecessarily difficult steps (e.g. compiling dependencies from source).
- Package/shared object naming differences between distros.

The current solution (shipping liblua and libsdl2 within our packages) has been controversial, and still doesn't work that well.  We should fix this properly before the release.
#5391 solves the lua naming issues for development versions, and we can set the lua dependencies in each package.  This just leaves the SDL2 dependency for debian and ubuntu 12.04, which could be solved by providing a libSDL2 deb on our download page.

As a further step (only if there is time -- this should not delay the release), @Mailaender has created https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/home:Mailaender/openra and filed https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=879845 about creating an official project.  We should be able to integrate this with our packaging scripts (via the `osc` debian package), and drop our horrible linux packaging scripts entirely.

data.title: Fix project files
data.body:
I would like to see the project files recreated from scratch because there have always been several problems.
- Building the solution in MonoDevelop is not enough, you have to have run make and I see make/MD build fighting over the symbol files
- The output should really go in a ./bin/ folder or something
- Mono.Nat warnings
- No (shared) assembly information
- No debug/release builds
- Maybe adopt the use of wildcard inclusions in the project files

data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5341

data.title: SW beacons staying on map
data.body: playtesting with psydev discovered during that time that if using multiple of the same superweapon with cheat in rapid succession, the beacons of all but the first used superweapon would stay on the map permanently.

data.title: progress-bars per queue at fixed location
Small Polish: Adds voices for aircraft's stop-orders
data.body:
Smallest commit ever (one-liner!), but i like it. :)

Hated it that RA/CNC Planes/Helis did not give any feedback when you pushed the stop-button.
Now they confirm it with their voices, as all other units do.

Regards.

data.title: Commit 531338a crashes VS debugger
data.body:
Using Win 7 + Visual Studio Professional 2013, commit 531338a (22th may 2:45) - "Preload sequences and fix #5382" and the following commits cause problems when i want to start debugging.

Using "start without debugging" (or directly starting the exe) works just fine;

but the debugging mode crashes without any message (have to ctrl-alt-del it), but only for RA and TD mods.

Setting the configuration manager to "release" build (instead of "debug") makes it halt at game.cs line 331, "throw new InvalidOperationException("No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.");".

What could this be and what can i do?

Something in the project build files?

data.title: "Cannot deploy here" sound is misleading.
data.body:
When attempting to placing a structure in an invalid location the user gets auditory feedback of
`Cannot deploy here.`
We should use (possibly have someone piece together) something closer to `Cannot build here.`
